channel.title: Help with ints

item.title: Help with ints
item.dc:creator: @lugmfr lugmfr
item.description:
@lugmfr wrote:

What my problem is: The cape looks fine until you turn around to the front, then the front of your body is invisible.

Example:

Back view:

Side view:

Front view(problem):

Hereâ€™s the ints.

	case 12744:
	itemDef.modelid = 65262;
	itemDef.name = "Max Cape";
	itemDef.modelZoom = 1385;
	itemDef.modelOffset1 = 0;
	itemDef.modelOffset2 = 24;
	itemDef.modelRotationX = 279;
	itemDef.modelRotationY = 948;
	itemDef.anInt165 = 65300;
	itemDef.anInt200 = 65322;
	itemDef.groundActions = new String[5];
	itemDef.groundActions[2] = "Take";
	itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
itemDef.itemActions[1] = "Wear";
	break;
case 12747:
itemDef.modelid = 65270;
itemDef.name = "Completionist Cape";
itemDef.modelZoom = 1385;
itemDef.modelOffset1 = 0;
itemDef.modelOffset2 = 24;
itemDef.modelRotationX = 279;
itemDef.modelRotationY = 948;
itemDef.anInt165 = 65297;
itemDef.anInt200 = 65297;
itemDef.groundActions = new String[5];
itemDef.groundActions[2] = "Take";
itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
itemDef.itemActions[1] = "Wear";
break;

case 12745:
itemDef.modelid = 65261;
itemDef.name = "Veteran Cape";
itemDef.modelZoom = 1385;
itemDef.modelOffset1 = 0;
itemDef.modelOffset2 = -5;
itemDef.modelRotationX = 279;
itemDef.modelRotationY = 948;
itemDef.anInt165 = 65305;
itemDef.anInt200 = 65318;
itemDef.groundActions = new String[5];
itemDef.groundActions[2] = "Take";
itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
itemDef.itemActions[1] = "Wear";
break;

It does the exact same thing for all capes.
Will rep++ if you help!
